page.title: 14Proposed sale of old school
page.content: The local school was originally endowed and presented to the village in 1871, but was closed in 1981. Children now attend either Junior School in West Hanney or secondary school in Wantage. The sale of the school building is now causing some controversy. The Church & the village both feel that they have a legitimate claim to the proceeds. The Diocesan Council of Education & Training plan to sell the school. The Parish has applied for a 3/14ths share to be divided with Lyford. It is uncertain whether the Church is entitled in law to this share, but the proceeds will have to be used for educational purposes in the Parish. It could not be used towards church repairs or to boost the Restoration Fund. There is much interest in purchasing the building for use as a Community Centre.
